extensionDescription.message: Do you remember the old good Eudora statistics? Do you miss them? Using this addon you can finally keep an eye on how you use your beloved Thunderbird!

InboxZeroFolderLocationNote.message: In this chart, all messages are considered, including duplicates that are filtered in the other charts. So, for example, if you use Gmail, you will see messages both in the folder they are in and in the "All Mail" folder.

AboutText_1.message: Do you remember the old good Eudora statistics? Do you miss them?

AboutText_2.message: Using this addon you can finally keep an eye on how you use your beloved Thunderbird!

AboutText_3.message: More features will be added in the future, but if you have an idea, send it

InboxZeroText_1.message: Inbox Zero is a rigorous approach to email management aimed at keeping the inbox empty — or almost empty — at all times.

InboxZeroText_2.message: ThunderStats gives you some insights on how you're managing your inbox.

OtherInfoText_1.message: All the statistics are calculated from the mails that are in the Thunderbird folders, associated with the mail addresses of the selected account.

OtherInfoText_2b.message: The statistics will be updated as soon as Thunderbird has updated the folders from the mail server.

GlobalDescSettingTab.message: Use these options to customize your ThunderStats experience!

AdvancedSettingTabDesc.message: These are advanced options, use them if you know what you're doing.

InfoMainDesc.message: This addon is free and developed in my spare time. If you're using it in your every day routine, feel free to support it with a little donation clicking on the link below. Thanks!!

ReopenTabDesc.message: You need to close and reopen the ThunderStats tab to make the changes effective.

ManageCustomIdentititesDesc_1.message: A custom identity is an email address, different from the ones registered for the account, with which you receive mails.

ManageCustomIdentititesDesc_2.message: Usually these are email addresses of mailing lists that you're subscribed to, where your email address is not used in any 'to' or 'cc' fields.

CustomIdentititesAccount.message: Custom Identitites for the selected Account

CustomIdentititesAccount.Info.message: Add an email address per line, or separated by a comma.

TodayTimeChartShowYesterday.message: Show also yesterday's mails in the today time chart

TimeChartProgressive.message: Show cumulative values in the today and yesterday time charts

ManyDays.message: Number of days to be shown

CustomQueryBookmarkImmediateUpdate.message: When selecting a custom date range view, update the statistics immediately

DatePickerLocale.message: Locale setting for the date picker

folderspreadchart_openinfirsttab.message: From the mails folder locations chart, open the folder always in the first tab

InvolvedNum.message: Number of recipients or senders to be shown in "Top" tables

prefs_FirstDayWeek.message: Choose the first day of the week

prefs_load_data_changing_account.message: Reload data when changing the account

prefs_filter_duplicates_multi_account.message: Filter duplicate messages when multiple accounts are selected

prefs_include_archive_multi_account.message: Include archives when multiple accounts are selected

ImportantInfoText_1.message: Some email providers, such as Gmail, have an "Archive" folder that contains all messages. However, the same messages are also present in individual folders. Considering the "Archive" folders in the statistics could lead to counting them twice.

ImportantInfoText_1b.message: On the advanced options page, you can choose how to manage these accounts. If an account has a "gmail.com" address, it will be set up correctly; otherwise, you will have to set it up manually.

ImportantInfoText_2.message: If you want to help translate ThunderStats into a new language or improve an existing translation, you can do so! Your contributions are invaluable in making this addon accessible to a wider audience.

AdvancedAccountList_Desc.message: Below, you can choose to ignore the archive folders or filter out the duplicate messages. Filtering messages will increase the time required to calculate the statistics, but it will yield better results. If you do not use Gmail's archiving function, you can choose not to activate this feature and simply exclude the archive folders directly. The Inbox Zero folder locations chart will always display all emails. Therefore, if an email is received and appears in two folders, it will be shown in both folders on the chart.

PrivacyInfoText_1.message: All data processing is performed locally on your device. No data is transmitted, shared, or stored on any external servers or third-party services. This ensures that your information remains private and secure at all times.

Label_bday_use_last_business_day.message: If yesterday is not a business day, show the last business day instead.

Label_bday_default_only.message: Consider business days only in aggregate statistics (max, min, average).

Yearly_Desc.message: This day will be a non-business day on every year.

deletePromptNBD_text.message: Are you sure you want to delete this non-business day?

EasterNoBusinessDay.message: Easter and Easter Monday are non-business days.

AccountWithNoEmails.message: The selected account has no associated emails. You need to add a custom identity in the options page.

InfoTotal_AllMails.message: This total value accounts for both business and non-business days.

InfoTotal_BDMails_Only.message: These values account for business days only.
